NODE 03A // ENTRY

Family Guy Is Still a Masterpiece

[2026.02.16]

As someone living in New England, Family Guy always hits a little harder. The regional references, weather jokes, random local energy, and fast-paced chaos all feel familiar in the best way.

What I love most is how the show keeps evolving while still feeling like itself. Even after so many years on air, it stays sharp, weird, and genuinely funny. The writing still lands, the cutaway format still works, and the show somehow keeps finding new angles without losing its identity.

For me, it is one of those rare long-running series that remains rewatchable because it balances absurd humor with recognizable day-to-day life. That mix is exactly why I still think Family Guy is a masterpiece.

Source image: Wikipedia - Peter Griffin
